title: Release v0.3.0 with inline command execution and improvements
description:
**As a** Consoul maintainer
**I want** to release version 0.3.0 to PyPI with all recent improvements
**So that** users can access new features like inline shell command execution and security fixes

**Context:**
Since v0.2.0, we've completed significant feature work and critical fixes:
- SOUL-196: Inline shell command execution (major new feature)
- SOUL-233: OpenAI stream_options fix
- SOUL-231: ChatLlamaCpp context size extraction
- SOUL-228: Security vulnerability fixes (torch 2.9.1, urllib3 2.6.0)
- SOUL-186: Anthropic prompt caching cost tracking
- SOUL-183: Search configuration improvements
- SOUL-192: InitializationErrorScreen for failure handling
- Plus documentation, PDF support, and TUI improvements

The inline command execution feature (SOUL-196) is a significant enhancement that warrants a minor version bump to 0.3.0.

**Technical Notes:**
- Current version: 0.2.2 (in pyproject.toml lines 7 and 124)
- Last release tag: v0.2.0
- Target version: 0.3.0
- Release requires updating version in both [project] and [tool.poetry] sections
- Build system: Poetry
- Distribution: PyPI (https://pypi.org/project/consoul/)
- Docs: https://consoul.goatbytes.io

**Acceptance Criteria:**

**Given** all tests pass and code is ready for release
**When** I update version to 0.3.0 in pyproject.toml
**Then** both [project] version (line 7) and [tool.poetry] version (line 124) are updated

**Given** version is updated
**When** I generate the changelog
**Then** CHANGELOG.md includes all features, fixes, and improvements since v0.2.0

**Given** changelog is complete
**When** I build and publish to PyPI
**Then** package is available at https://pypi.org/project/consoul/ with version 0.3.0

**Given** package is published
**When** I create a git tag
**Then** tag v0.3.0 exists and is pushed to remote

**Given** release is complete
**When** users run pip install --upgrade consoul
**Then** they receive version 0.3.0 with all new features

**Testing Considerations:**
- Run full test suite: poetry run pytest
- Verify pre-commit hooks pass
- Test package build locally: poetry build
- Test installation from built package: pip install dist/consoul-0.3.0-py3-none-any.whl
- Manual smoke test of TUI and inline command execution
- Verify documentation is up to date

**Implementation Steps:**

1. Update Version (pyproject.toml lines 7 and 124: 0.2.2 â†’ 0.3.0)
2. Generate CHANGELOG.md with all improvements since v0.2.0
3. Run tests and quality checks (pytest, ruff, mypy, pre-commit)
4. Build package (poetry build)
5. Test installation locally
6. Publish to PyPI (poetry publish)
7. Create and push git tag v0.3.0
8. Create GitHub release with changelog
9. Update documentation
10. Verify installation works

**Dependencies:**
- All current tickets in progress should be complete
- All tests passing
- PyPI credentials configured

**Estimated Time:** 2-3 hours
